simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalitems
Enum Category

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<Category>
      simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalitems.Category
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Category>
public enum Category
extends Enum<Category>

This is an enumeration of the grammatical categories which are relevant to the Lexicon package.

Any item that instantiates the LexicalItem interface must implement the getCategory() method, which returns a constant defined in this enum. The Category of a LexicalItem also determines which (if any) morphological rules can apply to it.

Recognised grammatical categories are: NOUN, ADJECTIVE, VERB, DETERMINER, PRONOUN, SYMBOL, ALL_CATEGORIES

Author:
agatt

getPartOfSpeech

public String getPartOfSpeech()
Returns:
A string representation of the category. For example, if the category is NOUN, this returns "N"

getCategory

public static Category getCategory(String c)
                            throws IllegalArgumentException
Utility method: Returns the actual Category constant which matches the name of the category.

Parameters:
c - The name of the category. Recognised names are "n(oun)", "adj(ective)", "v(erb)", "d(et)", "p(ro)", "s(ymbol)" and "all".
Returns:
The Category whose name is c
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the name passed as argument is unrecognised.
IllegalArgumentException
